summary: An Ordinance authorizing The Seattle Electric Company, its successors and assigns, to temporarily cease the operation of its railway on certain portions of Virginia Street, Fourth Avenue, Belle Street, Fifth Avenue and Denny Way in the City of Seattle, being Route No. 5 of Ordinance No. 5874, entitled "An Ordinance granting to J. D. Lowman and Jacob Furth, their successors and assigns, a franchise to construct, maintain and operate street railways in the City of Seattle", approved March 9, 1900, until the expiration of ninety (90) days after the completion of the regrade of Denny Hill.
